intro: Psychrogeton aucheri, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Psychrogeton aucheri is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
